Men's Therapeutic Practitioner - A Better Way

Company Name Anglicare Victoria Company Location Frankston

New Posted Date Posted 2 hours ago

Be an early applicant

Job description

A Better Way is new program that will engage and work with Aboriginal and non-Aboriginal fathers, who use or have used family violence, to reduce the risk and increase the safety and wellbeing for their children and adult victim survivors. This exciting\xa0new role offers:


  • A chance to make a difference for adult and child victims of family violence
  • An opportunity to work with Anglicare Victoria, an employer of choice, where employees feel valued and rewarded
  • Exciting career\xa0and professional development opportunities

About Us:


At Anglicare Victoria our focus is on transforming the futures of children and young people, families and adults. Our work is based on three guiding pillars, Prevent, Protect, Empower. We offer a comprehensive network of services and seek to ensure the provision of high quality services that will bring about significant improvements in the life experience of the young people, children and families/caregivers with whom we work.


The Position:\xa0


Anglicare Victoria and VACCA will specifically trial the Safe & Together model as the foundation for a flexible community-based perpetrator intervention program which can respond to Aboriginal and non-Aboriginal fathers using violence\xa0against their families. The role will work within a culturally safe\xa0environment and include the provision of\xa0intake assessments,\xa0 safety planning, individual contracts and goals, therapeutic counselling and tailored responses to the individual and family.


To Be Successful in this Position You Will Need:


  • Tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline such as Social Work, Psychology, Welfare Work or relevant Allied Health Sciences.
  • Demonstrated experience in working with Aboriginal children and families and significant competence in culturally safe practice.
  • Knowledge, experience and practice in models of contemporary approaches in the Family Violence field including experience in family violence informed risk assessments, with strong knowledge and skills in working with men and child and family based approaches.
  • Proven interpersonal skills and excellent written communication ability.

Please Note: It is mandatory for the successful applicant to hold a current Working with Children Check and be prepared to undergo a National Criminal History Check prior to commencement.


For a detailed position description,\xa0\xa0PD_Mens Therapeutic Practitioner_South_Full time fixed term_Sept 2018.pdf


To apply for this position you will need to complete the online application. You will be requested to attach your resume and your responses to the Key Selection Criteria as separate documents.


For further enquiries contact\xa0\xa0Nikki Ball, Manager of Family Violence and Service Integration\xa0on\xa097816700


Applications close on 10th October 5 pm


We encourage and welcome applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander People

Mid-Senior level

Job description

Job Description

Quantum Computing Research Scientist

From landing the first astronauts on the moon to building the first cognitive system to win Jeopardy!, IBM with its diverse culture, continues to be the innovative spark of the computing revolutions that shape our world. At the core of IBM’s innovation are its 12 global research labs. IBM Research Australia is a young, proud and diverse community working on industry solutions, conceiving, designing and building next generation enterprise systems.

IBM Research – Australia is looking for a Research Scientist to join the growing Melbourne-based team in the exciting area of quantum computing. They will work as part of a team of applied physicists, computer scientists, and engineers on the quantum computing effort at IBM. Ideal candidates will have familiarity/understanding of quantum error correction and fault-tolerant quantum computing; they should be comfortable implementing quantum algorithms, or classical decoding algorithms and writing and using modelling, simulation, and/or optimisation software for these goals. A demonstrated record of research is highly preferred in any of the following: novel fault tolerance protocols, efficient methods to protect quantum information, overhead reduction, circuit optimisation, or incorporating realistic, experimentally-motivated constraints into fault-tolerance protocols.

Required Technical And Professional Expertise
  • Ph.D. in Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or a related discipline is required.
  • At least 2 years of demonstrated research record in quantum computing, this can include graduate-level research
  • Strong programming background with Python
Preferred Tech and Prof Experience
  • Familiarity with writing research-grade software tools
  • Familiarity with modern quantum computing programming paradigms
Application's for this role close on the 21st September 2018.

  • What we do matters be part of creating new products to disrupt old industries

Join PwC’s Innovation and Ventures team to build new and exciting market-facing digital platforms - commercially-savvy, technically-deep, risk-taking, and backed by a great brand, this is a focused product team who love what they do and working together.

This role will start by helping to build PwC’s Automation Engine, the platform that digitises businesses by automating how they work. We need team members who are enthusiastic about working in a dynamic, agile way to provide users a seamless experience while automating decision making, collaboration and documentation.

Join the team redefining your expectations of a big firm, at LinkedIn’s number one place to work .

About The Role

You will be deeply involved in the development of an innovative SaaS platform. You will work directly on the core platform, building out new features and taking ownership of the future technical direction.

We are one team with a flat structure, developing people with mentoring and coaching, rather than a traditional management approach, where everyone contributes to personal and team success.

  • Enthusiasm, curiosity and individual accountability are key to success in Innovation and Ventures, along with minimum technical proficiencies including
  • Experience with Ruby and Rails. A solid practical understanding of MVC and good OOP practices.

PwC is a global leader in professional services with a network across 158 countries. At PwC you will get the opportunity to perform a great variety of work and showcase your skills while you learn and innovate. Our clients range from startups to the largest global organisations.

Sound like you? Read on.

What We Offer

Working for Australia’s largest professional services firm you’ll join a global network spanning 157 countries that delivers meaningful outcomes for a wide range of clients.

Our culture and benefits are why we’re LinkedIn’s number one Australian workplace. With state of the art offices and premium technology, each person has access to flexible work options. The dress policy is flexible too – you choose what you wear based on the work you do with your team and clients.

Fostering an inclusive culture and embracing differences is at the core of everything we do. PwC empowers you to be yourself and work with people from many backgrounds to achieve things never thought possible. Get involved in our employee-led diversity networks (cultural, disability, LGBTI or gender equality) and benefit from our best-in-class policies such as 18 weeks maternity/paternity leave, flexible work and gender equity.

Up for a challenge? We’re committed to helping our people unleash their potential. Hard work doesn’t go unrewarded and industry best coaching, mentoring, training and development are ready and waiting. If you hold a genuine desire to make a difference and want to surround yourself with like-minded, talented and driven individuals who strive to do the same, apply now.

PwC is committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce. Our Reconciliation Action Plan sets out our commitment to increase Indigenous employment. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Australians.

884756426:
[

Security Engineer

Company Name REA Group Company Location Richmond, Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 7 hours ago Number of views 30 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


If you're looking for a security-by-the-numbers role, this isn't the job for you. If you are looking to work alongside some of the brightest and best in the industry - read on!

The Group Security Team create tech to protect REA across corporate infrastructure and Cloud environments, driving the adoption of security patterns and practices by the rest of the business to be built into their own infrastructure.

We're looking to level up on the Security services we provide, and we'd love you to come help us.



About the role
The Security Engineer sits within the Group Security Team, based in Melbourne. Our lean and agile business is home to some of the world's best software, hardware and cloud engineers. You'll be a system engineer by trade with exposure to security in a fast-moving environment. You will be used to getting into the detail of understanding vulnerabilities and mitigation strategies, able to evaluate and implement security toolsets and capable of identifying threats to REA. You will also have experience responding to incidents and working closely with other DevOps teams to incorporate the patterns you develop. The role is both demanding and rewarding, providing opportunities to flex into areas outside your comfort zone.



What you'll be doing

  • Developing and communicating security patterns. Walking the talk, working with other business and technology teams in delivering security projects aligned to our security strategy.
  • Championing security and influencing business and technology stakeholders in its adoption.
  • Implementing, operating and supporting security tooling, services and patterns to support IT delivery teams.
  • Obsessively implementing good security hygiene
  • Have a security industry perspective, evaluating or taking the lead on emerging technologies, threat understanding and how external products and services can be used an integrated.
  • Assessing and mitigating vulnerabilities across our environments leveraging our engineering community.
  • Responding to security incidents and evaluating threats to REA.




What we expect:

  • An engineering practitioner with a strong security focus
  • Hands on experience proactively building and securely configuring AWS infrastructure
  • Proficient with Linux fundamentals and experience working with open source tools.
  • Security experience and interest in best practices, including knowledge on cloud, security protocols, cryptography and application security.
  • Familiarity with CI/CD tools such as BuildKite
  • Proficient in at least one programming/scripting language (Bash, Python, C# etc.)
  • Practical knowledge of different network topologies, protocols and principles of secure network architecture & design.
  • Experience with security devices and technologies (WAFs, IDS/IPS, Firewalls etc.) across multiple platforms.
  • Experience with performing vulnerability assessments and penetration tests. Understanding of the OWASP Top 10 with the ability to assist Product teams with remediation of findings.
  • Security qualifications (Offensive Security, GIAC GPEN, similar) preferred.




What is it like to work with us?
Each team has around 10 people who collectively represent technology, business, and product and work together to maintain existing products while building new capabilities for the business. Each day we get together, talk about what we've just done, what we're about to do then work together during the day. We believe strongly in pairing, testing, continuous improvement. Each week we participate in guilds across the company to keep our skills sharp and increase our impact, and in team retrospectives where we keep track of how our team is going. Your manager acts as a mentor to help guide you and your career, instead of being someone who monitors your day to day.



We're committed to creating inclusive, safe environments where anyone, no matter their background, can contribute and succeed.



What you get beyond a great remuneration package

  • Birthday leave. A day off for your birthday.
  • Flexible working arrangements. We've got people who work 4 days a week, and people who work from home.
  • 3 days every 4 months in our regular hackathon - See: http://hackday.realestate.com.au
  • Industry leading parental leave system.
  • Onsite health and wellbeing programs, including bike racks, yoga, massages and meditation classes along with showers and clean towels for when you work up a sweat.




About REA Group
REA Group is one of the world's largest property and lifestyle media companies. Best known in Australia for realestate.com.au, the market-leading property site and app, we're also a fast-growing global business spanning three regions. People use our sites and apps when finding a place to rent or buy (a home, co-work space or commercial property), as well as for property data, news, financial services, inspiration, renovation ideas, and to better understand their neighbourhoods and the property market. From our humble beginnings in a Melbourne garage more than 20 years ago, to a global company helping reimagine digital property experiences; we have played a key role in shaping the entire digital sector in Australia, especially through the talented people we have nurtured, and continue to develop.

Seniority Level

Mid-Senior level

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Business Development
  • Information Technology

Job description


About ME




We're not like other banks.



ME was created by the industry super funds to be different from the pack \xad- and we're passionate about staying that way as we head into an exciting and progressive future.



We are building a bank, a company and a brand that we can be proud of - but to achieve that, we need the best people.



To help ME get there, you'll challenge the status quo and share extraordinary ideas - and our size guarantees you'll have the opportunity, support, and environment to be heard.



ME's core purpose is helping all Australians get ahead - no conditions, asterisks or exceptions.



We believe everyone deserves the same opportunities in life, regardless of gender or identity, sexuality, ethnicity or religion. This is why we're so committed to an equal opportunity workplace - because we know our success won't come from focusing on similarities, but by embracing and celebrating our diversity.



About you


Let's get to the nitty-gritty, for this role we really need someone that comes from a credit assessment background as this will help us to make sure we are setting you up for success. Naturally you have a knack for numbers and your problem-solving skills are second to none and of course, you enjoy providing exceptional customer service.



When it comes to you, you are flexible, tenacious and adaptable, and enjoy working in a collaborative team. You're a quick thinker who is innovative and not afraid to think outside the square. Working to deadlines and in a fast paced environment really helps bring out your best and makes you shine.



About the role


As a Credit Officer, you will be responsible for managing a portfolio of loans/customers, ensuring compliance throughout the home loan approval and settlement process including all relevant legislative requirements are met. On top of this, you'll also be responsible for providing ME's valued customers with top notch customer service.



This role will see you partnering with our sales team to ensure customer expectations are met, as well as maintaining effective relationships with key contacts, internal and external stakeholders. This role sits in a dynamic team who always work together to optimise results, all while complying with ME Credit Risk Policy and documentation and putting the customer at the front of mind at all times.



The Perks:


At ME, we believe that work should be a place that you can make the most of - and these are just some of the many reasons why people love it here:







\xb7 Popular culture - that's not a claim, we've got the data to prove it. We genuinely care about each other and work in an encouraging and collaborative environment.



\xb7 The whole package - sure, we're going to reward you well with your salary package - but there are also lots of other perks - including discounted Myki travel cards, free health support, conveniently-located offices, plus much more.



\xb7 Not afraid to fail? We embrace action-oriented people like you. That's right, you can make mistakes here and it's ok - so long as you learn from them.



\xb7 To be ME, we need you - we're building something really cool and you get to directly influence what that is.



\xb7 ProudlyME - our internal pride network - has a swag of initiatives that show support, education, and passion toward our team and customers, demonstrating that ME is a strong advocate on equal rights for the LGBTIQ+ community.



\xb7 Meet the Execs - our Executive team is fun and full of passion because we know great managers mean happy staff.



Oh, and did we mention you get your very own ME branded Converse High-top shoes? Now that's a reason to get your foot in the door.



I want those Converse (and the job)



If this sounds like the perfect job for you, why wait? Apply now by submitting your cover letter and resume today.



Should an applicant be the preferred candidate, background checks (including police checks, reference checks, ASIC banned and disqualified persons and bankruptcy checks) will be completed prior to the candidate's employment being confirmed. The outcomes of the background checks do not automatically bar candidates; however, will be assessed against the inherent requirements of the job.

Code Compliance Analyst - Life Insurance

Company Name Australian Financial Complaints Authority Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 4 hours ago Number of views 6 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Code Compliance and Monitoring team serves Australian consumers by supporting financial service providers to continually improve their services. Working on behalf of independent committees, we monitor code compliance, investigate alleged code breaches and share examples of good industry practice.

\xa0

We currently have a full-time, fixed-term vacancy until 30 September 2020 for a Senior Code Compliance Analyst to work within our Code Compliance and Monitoring Team, focusing on Life Insurance Code matters.

\xa0

In this role, you will be responsible for supporting the Code Compliance Monitoring Committees and Code Compliance Manager by providing high quality compliance analysis and investigation of serious and systemic Code breach allegations. You will conduct research, draft correspondence and prepare reports as required for the Committee and take a lead role on a number of projects.

\xa0

You will also assist in the implementation of the compliance program for the Life Insurance Code of Practice. This is a significant time of change in the financial services industry and this role will assist in the development and delivery of that change by influencing culture within the industry.

\xa0

To be successful in this role, you will have considerable experience within the life insurance industry and have a strong technical background.

Ideally, you will be degree-qualified in a related discipline such as financial services, compliance, data analytics or law. You will have excellent written and oral communication skills and be able to demonstrate your strong ability to research, analyse and draw conclusions from data.

\xa0

In return, we offer you a competitive remuneration package, inclusive of salary packaging options. You will work within a close knit and supportive team, with career development opportunities and a positive work/ life balance. Extensive health and wellbeing initiatives are available including an onsite employee assistance program and fun social events.

\xa0

To apply for this role, please submit your CV and covering letter. Applications close 3 October 2018.

\xa0

For more information about this role please visit www.afca.org.au/careers, or email grinaldo@fos.org.au

Job description

Our client is a family run, boutique commercial carpet tile supplier to the A&D and Commercial Installer markets in Australia. They have a stable workforce with most staff members boasting 5yrs + tenure at the business.


They and are looking to expand their sales team with the addition of a Senior Sales Executive to sell their range of high-quality commercial flooring products. They have a well-recognised and award-winning product range that can be found in commercial buildings such as hotels, universities and offices.


This role has materialised through sustained growth in the Victorian market and the successful applicant will be joining a financially stable and growing business.

\xa0

Covering the Melbourne metro area this role is focused on winning specifications with interior architects and designers and protecting specifications with the builders and installers. The diversity of the role will offer an opportunity to sell on a technical, creative and commercial level depending on the application of the project you are pitching for.\xa0


Day to day you will be calling on all the above contacts, securing design specifications, tracking projects through and managing the relationships with the installers. \xa0Due to the nature of the long sales cycle targets will be minimal in your first year to allow you to build your pipeline and develop the territory.

\xa0

You will be an established sales professional and will have a good understanding of the construction industry. You will be a comfortable presenter; a natural rapport builder and you will be looking to work for a company with strong brands and products you can really be proud of.


\xa0You will play the long game with your customers and understand the importance of established and committed relationships. Our client can offer full training on the product range so whilst flooring experience is desirable our client places more emphasis on sales calibre, an eye for detail and your ability to win and break specifications.

By seeing things differently, Cushman & Wakefield anticipate market changes and are first to capitalise, ensuring clients and the business can be what’s next.

As part of the Finance team within the Portfolio Service Centre (PSC) this role will help to drive the delivery of contract administration and invoice management. The Administration Assistants are responsible for the financial management of Work orders from operational closure to billing, as well as management of Accounts Payable exceptions queues.

Responsibilities

The Administration Assistant will be responsible for the following activities:
  • Financial coding of Preventative Maintenance and Reactive Invoices from subcontractors
  • Raising & amending purchase orders
  • Review of Employee timecards for WO Time Accounting
  • Financially closing WO’s ready for invoicing
  • Efficient management of Accounts Payable exceptions queues
  • Finance Helpdesk, managing both internal & external queries
  • Stakeholder Engagement with efficient resolution of issues

Qualifications And Skills Required
  • Experience with JDE preferred
  • Experience in Accounts Payable beneficial
  • TAFE or High School certificate
Cushman & Wakefield is a large, global organization that cares about its people. If you are keen to work in a professional, energetic, and motivated business that takes pride in giving employees the opportunities to learn and advance their careers, then we would like to hear from you.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, Cushman & Wakefield encourages indigenous Australian and female candidates to apply.

Cushman & Wakefield provides equal employment opportunity. Discrimination of any type will not be tolerated. Cushman & Wakefield is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment withoutregard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law.

Manager Statutory Extracts

Permanent Full Time

Northern Health is the major provider of acute, sub-acute and ambulatory specialist services in Melbourne’s northern region, one of the fastest growing communities in Australia. Our acute and sub-acute health services cover over 555,000 people in our primary and secondary catchment areas, and we offer a range of in-patient and outpatient services to people at all stages of life. Northern Health covers four campuses; Northern Hospital Epping, Broadmeadows Hospital, Bundoora and Craigieburn.

An exciting opportunity exists for an enthusiastic, experienced and highly motivated Health Information Manager to join and lead the Health Information Services Statutory Extracts Team at Northern Health, which is responsible for the submission and reconciliation of VAED, VEMD, ESIS and VINAH related statutory extracts. This position is responsible for contributing to the effective leadership of the Health Information Services Statutory Extracts team by demonstrating outstanding business, development and analysis skills. The position is also responsible for the coordination of La Trobe Univeristy Health Information Management Students within Health Information Services.

This position requires a senior Health Information Manager with extensive experience in statutory extract reporting, excellent communication skills, high attention to detail and organisational skills who can work in a team environment, lead a team and relate well to all levels of staff.

As the HIS statutory extract team covers a variety of extracts, the role will involve knowledge and support of multiple data submissions, as well as be involved in understanding and implementing key organisation priorities and internal monitoring of health service performance, by ensuring data supports decision making and data integrity.

The position is based predominately at Northern Hospital Epping, however the successful applicant may be required to travel to all Northern Health campuses.

Job description

  • You’ve spent years honing your trade as a gun Front End Developer. HTML, CSS, JavaScript are all in your well-equipped arsenal.
  • You can see beyond the brief and understand the commercial opportunity, striving for efficiencies in execution and automation in process.
  • While front end is your core game, you also have some back-end skills up your sleeve and always looking to add to your skill base.


Our client is currently seeking to recruit versatile and proactive Senior Front End Developers to help drive change across it’s client’s brands.


Client details

The client utilises a unique approach to help organisation’s solve the challenge of delivering amazing customer experiences, across all digital channels, in an automated and highly measurable way. Our client believes that too many organisation’s have invested heavily in marketing and advertising technology, and the promise of a connected experience, without seeing the results they are seeking.

Our view is that businesses need access to a team of experts that can help them unlock the full potential of their technology investments. A team that is focused on challenging them to constantly improve, can advise across their entire technology stack and is invested in making them successful.

Our client provides the most transparent, collaborative and measurable partnership to help leading APAC brands to deliver value that matters. We’re not focused on just opens and clicks – we exist to drive revenue lift, customer engagement, transformational change and to push the boundaries in digital marketing.


The Ideal candidate

Tech skills and experience

  • In-depth understanding of the entire web development process (design, development and deployment).
  • Proficient understanding of web and email markup, including HTML5, CSS3.
  • Basic understanding of server-side CSS pre-processing platforms, such as LESS and SASS.
  • Proficient understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks, including jQuery.
  • Good understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX.
  • Be proficient with image authoring tools like Photoshop, to be able to crop, resize, or perform small adjustments on an image.
  • Proficient understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around them.
  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git / SVN / TFS.
  • Google Tag Manager
  • Good understanding of SEO principles and ensuring that application will adhere to them.


Soft skills and experience

  • You have experience across many MarTech applications and have realised that most organisation’s have their own unique ‘stack’ so it’s important to be well versed across the landscape.
  • You’ve spent years honing your trade as a gun Front End Developer. HTML, CSS, JavaScript are all in your well-equipped arsenal.
  • While front end is your core game, you also have some back-end skills up your sleeve and always looking to add to your skill base.
  • You can see beyond the brief and understand the commercial opportunity, striving for efficiencies in execution and automation in process.
  • What is best practice for some, is common sense to you. If you hear mobile first once more time, you’ll go postal.
  • You can listen to a client’s problem, decipher their needs and lead them towards an opportunity rather than always expecting a fully-fledged brief.
  • You’re looking for a role where you can be a leader and really push your ideas, vision and philosophy.
  • You want to work with a team that is collaborative, open and focused on delivering results. At the same time, you’re not afraid to think differently, share your opinion and can challenge the status quo – and are prepared to back it up.
  • Attention to detail is your middle name. Letting a mistake out into the wild really annoys you and you will not let that slide. This level of attention also means you question what you present to your team members, and to customers – it’s all about quality, not quantity, so you want to ensure that every presentation counts.
  • A start-up environment excites you. Being a part of something awesome from the ground up gives you a sense of pride and ownership. The need to be proactive and on the front foot suits your personality.


Summary of Key Responsibilities

  • Front End Developers work with Senior Development Leads
  • Ownership and implementation of development, testing and delivery processes.
  • Onsite testing tools e.g. Optimizely, Test and Target and Maxymiser.
  • Strong collaboration with Strategy and Client teams
  • You will be expected to present to clients, document solutions and stand behind your product. \xa0


Our client is building an exciting and best-in-class team. They want people that are hungry and eager to make an impact. People that have a passion for the digital marketing game combined with a deep desire to understand data and technology.

Outside of that, our client hopes to attract people who believe in creating a fun, exciting and collaborative workplace. And that when your day is filled with laughter and enjoyment you ’ll produce your best work.


We are currently shortlisting this role so please apply today. Candidates must have full working rights for Australia as no sponsorship is able to be offered.\xa0

Project Engineer - Grid Compliance

Company Name Vestas Company Location Melbourne

New Posted Date Posted 9 hours ago Number of views 21 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Are you looking for an exciting opportunity in a growing industry?

As Vestas grows into new markets, we are looking for strong leaders to help manage new opportunities. Vestas looks to accelerate innovation through the development of our employee's skills and talents.

Project Engineer- Grid Compliance

The role will ensure the grid connection compliance aspects of Vestas’ construction projects are delivered in accordance with the contract requirements, law and best practice

Responsibilities:

  • Support power system studies to define the wind farm generator performance standards and to develop the wind farm control system functional design specification and reactive plant requirements. Coordinate activities with the grid modelling department;
  • Review of Balance of Plant (BoP) design, drawing and document submissions from subcontractors against industry best practice, law, international and local standards, in addition to Vestas’ contractual and interfacing requirements from the perspective of grid connection compliance;
  • Ensure grid connection deliverables required to be submitted by Vestas are provided in a timely, safe and high-quality manner;
  • Liaise with internal and external stakeholders to ensure grid connection issues are resolved in a timely manner;
  • Undertake and support the procurement, design, installation, commissioning and testing of wind farm grid monitoring equipment, and control systems;
  • Undertake generator performance standards compliance testing, model validation (R2) testing, and generator registration with AEMO, including liaising with site based personnel;
  • Engage and manage power systems engineering consultancies when required;
  • Research and prepare formal responses to inquiries regarding wind farm technical performance. Prepare and deliver technical presentations to customer;
  • Attend and provide input to various safety, design, technical and risk meetings, workshops and reviews;
  • Assess Variations, Requests for Information (RFIs) and payment claims
  • Review tender specifications.

Qualifications:

  • Registered or Certified Professional Engineer (RPEng or CPEng)
  • Engineering degree in Electrical or Power Systems

Competencies:

  • Ability to manage consultants and designers in a construction environment – tier one companies valued
  • Experience in review of grid connection compliance design in a construction environment;
  • Any grid connection experience, especially wind farm registration will be highly valued
  • Generator and power systems modelling – wind farm modelling highly valued
  • Experience using PSS/E, PSCAD, PowerFactory simulation tools
  • Substation electrical design well regarded;
  • Any experience in negotiation with major stakeholders, such as clients, consultants, contractors and authorities;
  • Experience in high pressure environment;

What we offer:

  • A workplace that focuses on safety.
  • An opportunity to work with the world leader in wind energy.
  • The opportunity to further develop your skills and professional development.
  • Competitive remuneration.
  • Global career progression prospects.

Additional information:

You must have the right to live and work in this location to apply for this job.

All our career opportunities are listed on https://www.vestas.com/en/career

Vestas is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a safe, diverse and inclusive culture

We encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Australians with relevant skills and experience to apply to our advertised vacancies

About VESTAS

Vestas is the energy industry’s global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We design, manufacture, install, and service wind turbines across the globe, and with more than 94 GW of wind turbines in 79 countries, we have installed more wind power than anyone else.

Through our industry-leading smart data capabilities and unparalleled more than 79 GW of wind turbines under service, we use data to interpret, forecast, and exploit wind resources and deliver best-in-class wind power solutions. Together with our customers, Vestas’ more than 24,300 employees are bringing the world sustainable energy solutions to power a bright future.

We invite you to learn more about Vestas by visiting our website at http://www.vestas.com and following us on our social media channels.

Company Name AIA Australia Company Location Melbourne

Job description

WE’RE FOR your growth…

At AIA Australia we focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have all the opportunities to reach your full potential. Join one of Asia Pacific’s largest life insurers that is committed to your personal and professional growth.

The Email Marketing Specialist reports to the Digital CRM Manager, and will be a part of a wider digital team that supports the development and execution of different communication programs across the numerous channels AIA support. You will have 6-12 months worth of professional work experience and will be looking for the next step in your career.

Leveraging cloud based platforms and our digital channels you will be responsible for the design and execution of email marketing programs across the customer lifecycle journey. Experience with Marketo, Pardot, Eloqua, Salesforce Marketing Cloud or Adobe Campaign Manager is a must.

Some of the key responsibilities of this role include:

  • Design and develop effective demand generation and lead nurture practices, including lead scoring models, lead lifecycle and lead handover processes
  • Support the best practice design and implementation of customer lifecycle engagement program
  • Develop and manage closed loop reporting process across all digital channels to measure and monitor marketing activity effectiveness and ROI against business goals, and using insights to improve future activity

WE’RE FOR your wellbeing…

We understand healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing, inclusion and flexibility. With fruit box deliveries, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership (including a FitBit!), we endorse work-life balance.

WE’RE FOR your recognition…

We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. When people feel valued, they become more productive and satisfied, and we want you to feel inspired every day.

WE’RE FOR your success…

Your success is ours. Not only do we provide you with all the resources for you to thrive, we enable you to be the best that you can be. We encourage creative thinking and you will even be rewarded for it!

WE’RE FOR you…

For further information please contact jasio.dunford@aia.com or https://www.linkedin.com/in/jasiodunford/

Territory Planning Manager

Company Name Australia Post Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 61 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Summary

Develop sales targets across territories that will drive sales growth!

Overview

Australia Post is changing at an incredible pace. In the Business and Government department, we’ve integrated technological services that help large organisations and government departments adapt in an increasingly digital world without relegating on our historically successful offering of parcels and mail - all of which helps move Australia forward.

And we’re only getting started.

Nowadays, our plans are to lead the enterprise, business and government service space by encompassing our full range of products. And to get there, we’re on the lookout for ambitious people to join our truly diverse team. Working within a start-up culture that’s backed by all the resources Australia Post provides, the opportunity to innovate and push boundaries to improve services for all Australians is ready and waiting.

What's the job involve?

The Territory & Planning Manager is responsible for developing the sales targets for each territory to ensure Business & Government is able to meet its overall sales target. This role will see you conduct regular reviews to ensure customer allocation by territory is optimal and adapts if necessary. It manages people resources and capacity, and allocates customer portfolios across territories to drive sales growth. In addition, you will be responsible for providing governance to the sales process to ensure fair and correct working processes.

What It's Like To Work Here

For you, it means you'll do great work, learn from the best and develop a career within a robust and well-invested but empowering and creative environment. We all work hard – we're working on major challenges, after all – but we also recognise that you have a life outside of the office, so we provide flexible conditions that enable you to grow whilst enjoying genuine work life balance.

We’re Looking For Someone With
  • Significant experience in sales administration and strategy within a commercial environment.
  • Strong background using data and financial metrics.
  • Experience in governance and planning across a diverse and complex organisational design.
  • Ability to influence and drive outcomes in a multi layered product and services environment.
  • Strong relationship management skills.
  • Clear and engaging communication style with the ability to present in a dynamic and responsive manner.
  • Experience in navigating complex political and organisational nuances.

We see our culture just as important and therefore the successful candidate will display:
  • Excellent decision making ability.
  • Highly driven with a passion for results.
  • Be service focused in everything they do.
  • Are willing to take on feedback and strive for continuous improvement.


Benefits & Culture

Technical skills are important, however they are not everything.

We believe a diverse and inclusive workplace brings out the best in our people. We encourage applications from people of all ages, nationalities, cultures and disabilities. A career at Australia Post Group can lead down many paths and we are passionate about offering a supportive, inclusive culture, competitive compensation and flexible working conditions that enable you to develop whilst enjoying genuine work life balance.

To register your interest with our passionate careers team, please apply and remember to upload your details and your most recent resume.

  • Retail
  • Financial Services

PM Transport Manager

Company Name Toll People Company Location Altona North, Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 33 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


Who are we?


The Toll Group is the Asian region's leading provider of integrated logistics services, generating annual revenue of AU$8.3 billion and employing over 40,000 people across an extensive network of 1,200 sites throughout more than 50 countries across the world.


The Opportunity?


Reporting directly to the Operations Manager of GOS Linehaul unit you will be delivering on the linehaul schedules and plans for the Altona North site as developed by the Linehaul Control Tower, ensuring that any deviations or service interruptions are identified, managed and controlled. This role has a significant focus on linehaul operational excellence, ensuring that the right plans and capabilities exist to deliver a seamless linehaul service, and that the appropriate compliance and safety standards are delivered


Additionally, you will be responsible for:

  • Manage day to day operational linehaul movements for the Vic/Tas Intermodal & Specialised Solutions business to ensure all activities are in line with the direction provided by the Linehaul Control Tower
  • Effectively lead, develop, motivate and engage the group of company drivers to maximise performance levels.
  • Coordinate the routing and resource planning of linehaul services and drivers to ensure maximum utilisation of fleet.
  • Engage and motivate a team of local linehaul drivers and subcontractors to drive peak performance and safety standards, including the management of induction and ongoing compliance training
  • Comply with Toll's Occupational Health and Safety (OHS) related policies and procedures.




The Ideal Candidate?


The successful candidate will have extensive experience in a high volume transport environment, specialist skills in transport planning, complex routing and logistics scheduling. You will be required to successfully manage staff and drivers on a daily basis but also to look forward and implement sustained structure and process initiatives to continually improve the operation and the operational metrics.


In return, you will be rewarded with an inclusive and dynamic team environment, a passionate company culture and the opportunity to be an integral part of Toll's new direction.


For a confidential discussion regarding the role please contact Heath Wickins, Toll People, 03 9049 4019


We will not be liable for any fees or costs associated with unsolicited CVs sent directly to line managers from recruitment agencies.

Creative design studio | Open culture | Award-winning workplace

The Role

Are you an energetic landscape architect looking to work in the creative design space? An exciting opportunity exists for a qualified Landscape Architect to join our growing Melbourne studio working on public realm and infrastructure projects on a 12-month contract.

About You

You will have 4-6 years experience as a Landscape Architect working in the private sector. Ideally delivering complex projects as part of collaborative consultancy team.

You will have demonstrated knowledge/experience in project delivery, detail design and documentation skills. Ideally, you possess horticultural skills or a horticultural qualification and Revit experience would be a bonus but not essential.

Why HASSELL?

At HASSELL we specialise in hard working urban public realm and are interested in pushing the scope and role of landscape architecture in streetscape, civil, building and infrastructure.

We consider our people to be our greatest resource. With that in mind, we place great emphasis on attracting, retaining and developing the best talent. We place value on the quality of ideas and the contribution our people make to our open and collaborative culture. We support innovation and creativity to enable exceptional design outcomes.

Benefits

We value diversity, employing people across a number of regions, representing many different cultures and ethnic backgrounds.

_Creative studio working environment
_Inter studio transfer opportunities
_Development and training including access to an online training program
_Wellbeing benefits
_Flexible start and finish times, part time and job share arrangements
_Professional memberships
_Study assistance.

If you aspire to create great places and are looking to take the next step in your career with an international design practice, this is the role for you.

Apply now

Security Applications Expert

Company Name Telstra Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 11 hours ago Number of views 13 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About The Role

There’s no other communications company in Australia that has the range of opportunities on offer like at Telstra! We are a company that shapes the world of tomorrow through technology, join the team and further your career in more ways than you can imagine.

You Daily Accountabilities Include But Not Limited To

We are looking for a driven Security Applications Expert to join our Security Technology Operations (STO) team. Security Technology Operations (STO) is tasked with application support of all Telstra security applications utilised to monitor and action security events impacting Telstra. These tools provide security management across all of Telstra’s internal systems and staff as well as customers as contracted with the inclusion of security services. As the Security Applications Expert, your primary responsibility is to provide support in ensuring enterprise security architecture frameworks, services and solutions are in place to address security and compliance needs of the business.
  • Provide application support leadership and subject matter expertise across multiple security applications (AGS, Arcsight, CyberArk, McAfee products (MVM, AV, ePO, DLP), Arbor, ADOSP, Falcon Crowdstrike, FireEye, Tripwire (TE/TLC), Avecto, SAST & ZIPS
  • Provide (security) technical expertise support working on a number of initiatives that contribute to the delivery of Telstra's corporate security platforms/technologies
  • Conduct monitoring of security platforms/products across networks, IT and endpoint to identify, test and deliver solutions
  • Collaborate with internal customers to capture information and cyber security requirements that support enhancements and problem resolution to deliver innovative solutions
  • Maintain tracking and traceability between requirements, design, and test cases to demonstrate evidence of milestones to achieve solutions
  • Develop proof of concept environments including vendor comparisons, document and run test cases, and prepare reports on effectiveness of outcomes to drive delivery of required solutions
  • Participate in an after-hours rostered recall or planned works as required, and respond to security application incidents in a timely manner.

To be successful in this role, you will have the following experience/qualifications/attributes:
  • Solid working knowledge across some of the following security applications used by STO: AGS, Archsight, CyberArk, McAfee products (MVM, AV, ePO, DLP), Arbor, ADOSP, Falcon Crowdstrike, FireEye, Tripwire (TE/TLC), Avecto, SAST & ZIPS)
  • Working knowledge of Cisco Networking Technologies, Check Point, Palo Alto & Endace devices.
  • Proven experience in a programming/scripting tool such as bash, Python, Ansible will be highly regarded
  • Background in Incident, Change and Problem management practices
  • Application Support experience
  • Experience performing proactive problem management of all platforms to remove "time bombs" and maximise availability.

In return for all your hard work within this role, you will be given exposure to a wide variety of career pathways within Telstra, with plenty of scope for learning and development. If this role fits with your career goals and experience, click apply now!

Benefits And Career Path

Working for the most successful Telco Company in Australia also brings with it some great benefits, including: Working with the top IT Specialists in the APAC Region who provide support and mentoring, Substantial discounts on a range of Telstra products (including FOXTEL), Financial benefits such as Telstra Share Options, Great Salary Packaging Options and discounts on various retail, health and fitness and entertainment areas, Excellent work/life balance that allows you to have an excellent divide of personal needs and work commitments and performance bonuses*. Check out our website for more information and testimonials from our Employees.

We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce. To enable everyone to participate, we’ve developed an ‘All Roles Flex’ policy to consider flexible ways of working for every role. To learn more, visit
